gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਪਤਿਬ੍ਰਿਤਾ ਪਤਿਬ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਮੈ ਸਾਵਧਾਨ ਤਾਹੀ ਤੇ ਗ੍ਹਿੇਸੁਰ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਾੲਿਕਾ ਕਹਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Patibritaa Patibriti Mai Saavadhaana , Taahee Tay Grihaysur Hui Naaikaa Kahaavaee ?
translation: Just as a loyal and faithful wife is ever conscious of fulfilling her wifely obligations, and that makes her the prime person of the family.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਨ ਬਸਨ ਧਨ ਧਾਮ ਕਾਮਨਾ ਪੁਜਾਵੈ ਸੋਭਤਿ ਸਿੰਗਾਰ ਚਾਰਿ ਸਿਹਜਾ ਸਮਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Asan Basan Dhan Dhaam Kaamanaa Pujaavai , Sobhati Singaar Chaari Sihajaa Samaavaee ?
translation: Her husband fulfils all her needs of bedding, clothing, food, wealth, house and other property, and she in returns embellishes herself to enjoy oneness with her husband on the nuptial bed,

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਨ ਕੳੁ ਰਾਖਤ ਗ੍ਹਿਸਤ ਮੈ ਸੰਪਦਾ ਸਮੂਹ ਸੁਖ ਲੁਡੇ ਤੇ ਲਡਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Satigur Sikhan Kau Raakhat Grihasat Mai , Sanpadaa Samooh Soukh Luday Tay Ladaavaee ?
translation: Similarly, the True Guru keeps His devoted and obedient Sikhs lovingly in their householders life. With the blessings of ambrosial name of the Lord, he reaches the spiritual peace in their family life.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਨ ਬਸਨ ਧਨ ਧਾਮ ਕਾਮਨਾ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਭਾੳੁ ਦੁਤੀਅਾ ਮਿਟਾਵੲੀ ||੪੮੧||
transliteration: Asan Basan Dhan Dhaam Kaamanaa Pavitra , Aan Dayv Sayv Bhaau Douteeaa Mitaavaee ?481?
translation: In the desire of the sacred name, the True Guru blesses His Sikhs with food, bedding, clothing, mansions and other worldly assets. He removes all their duality of serving and following other gods and goddesses.  (481)
